2.text: “Do you think this to be your right, or do you say, ‘My righteousness is more than God’s,’

3.text: That you ask, ‘What advantage will it be to you? What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned?’

4.text: I will answer you, and your companions with you.

5.text: Look to the heavens, and see. See the skies, which are higher than you.

6.text: If you have sinned, what effect do you have against him? If your transgressions are multiplied, what do you do to him?

7.text: If you are righteous, what do you give him? Or what does he receive from your hand?

8.text: Your wickedness may hurt a man as you are, and your righteousness may profit a son of man.

9.text: “By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry out. They cry for help by reason of the arm of the mighty.

10.text: But none says, ‘Where is God my Maker, who gives songs in the night,

11.text: who teaches us more than the animals of the earth, and makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?’

12.text: There they cry, but none gives answer, because of the pride of evil men.

13.text: Surely God will not hear an empty cry, neither will the Almighty regard it.

14.text: How much less when you say you don’t see him. The cause is before him, and you wait for him!

15.text: But now, because he has not visited in his anger, neither does he greatly regard arrogance.

16.text: Therefore Job opens his mouth with empty talk, and he multiplies words without knowledge.”
